title: Analog IC Product Engineer
summary: Do you love crafting sophisticated solutions to highly complex challenges? Do you intrinsically see the importance in every detail? As part of our Silicon Technologies group, you’ll help design and manufacture our next-generation, high-performance, power-efficient processor, system-on-chip (SoC). Joining this group means you’ll be responsible for crafting and building the technology that operates Apple’s devices. Together, you and your team will enable our customers to do all the things they love with their devices. We promote innovation and new technology. The people who work here have reinvented and defined entire industries with the Mac, iPhone, iPad, Apple TV, Apple Watch, AirPods, HomePod and a multitude of groundbreaking Accessories. The same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices — strengthening our dedication to leave the world better than we found it. You should join us to help deliver the next amazing Apple product! We are seeking a multifaceted engineer to be responsible for driving and coordinating New Product Introduction (NPI) activity for Analog IC devices. You'll partner with multi-functional teams to debug, characterize and root cause diverse failure mechanisms.
description:
-  Coordinate New Product Introduction activities for Analog IC devices.
-  Define ATE characterization test plans and generate characterization reports.
-  Finalize test limits and define guard-bands based on ATE-bench correlations, GRR and PVT characterization results.
-  Work with Design and TE to identify potential TTR and yield improvement plans prior to mass production release.
-  Support QA and Reliability with diverse Product Qualification requirements (HTOL board design, BI shift analysis, reliability guard-band, etc.)
-  Drive GRR analysis and coordinate cross-platform correlation activities.
-  Perform statistical data analysis on mass production data sets.
-  Work with internal teams to support mass production ramp as needed.
-  Support Test Engineering with test program release activities.
-  Define turning points and communicate product development schedule on regular basis.
preferred_qualifications:
Exposure to different package technologies is a plus.
Exposure to applications with PMIC/PMUs, Display Drivers or Sensors is a plus.
Experience with ATE development and/or Bench validation is a plus
Scripting experience in Python or R is a plus
